get.description:

content.name: Set User's Manager
content.description: This action sets a user's manager in Salesforce.

content.name: No Op
content.description: This is a no operation action.

content.name: Edit User's Profile
content.description: This action edits a user's profile in Salesforce

content.name: Remove Mobile Device
content.description: This action removes a user's device from Mobile Device Management in the Google Admin Console.

content.name: Clear User Sessions
content.description: This action clears a user's sessions in Okta.

content.name: Suspend User
content.description: This actions suspends a user account in Okta.

content.name: Set File Collaborator Permissions
content.description: This action sets the permissions for a file's collaborators in Google Drive.

content.name: Wipe Mobile Device
content.description: This action allows you to perform an account wipe or mobile wipe of a user's device. For more information about using this feature and the prerequisites for it to work correctly, please see this Google Help article.

content.name: Edit User's Phone Number
content.description: This action edits a user's work or home phone number in Google. If 'Replace existing phone number' is selected, then all phone numbers of the selected type (work or home) will be overwritten.

post.description:
Execute an action using BetterCloud's Action Engine.

Actions are executed asynchronously. After successfully initiating an action, an `executionId` will be returned in the response body.
The `executionId` can be used to poll the execution status.

Use the above `List Action` endpoint to determine the required parameters for the action you wish to execute.  For this request body, you will provide an object with key-value pairs.  Looking back at the above endpoint, for each parameter from that response, the `id` value should be a key in this request body and the value should be the value for the parameter. 
For example, the `Create User` for G Suite action has a required parameter for email with `id`: 4ea33cfc-f5d8-4b2c-9cba-9d8c05096ee3.  In your request body, you would have an entry `"4ea33cfc-f5d8-4b2c-9cba-9d8c05096ee3": "user@domain.com"`

A common use case is to execute a specific action every time an event occurs in another system.  For example, if you want to have BetterCloud create a Google user everytime a user is created in BambooHR, you can configure BambooHR to send push notifications to this endpoint.  The request payload from BambooHR will not match our expected contract, so you would have to use a pre-request script (can be created at https://developer.bettercloud.com/#/scripts/new).  In order to tell our system what pre-request scripts you would like to run, you can apply the list of script IDs as either the `BC-Transform-IDs` header or the `BC-Transform-IDs` query parameter.  If you provide multiple script IDs, they will be executed in the order provided.

https://api.bettercloud.com

text/plain.example: POST, GET, PUT, OPTIONS, DELETE, PATCH

default-src 'none'; script-src 'self' 'sha256-xWNWy6g4QpHCwZRdmLfI81eyBjRIztPmws2tVdvXBmg=' https://g.alicdn.com https://fullstory.com https://storage.googleapis.com https://*.atlassian.net https://*.elev.io https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com https://ajax.googleapis.com https://*.zopim.com https://*.fullstory.com https://accounts.google.com https://cdn.evergage.com https://bettercloud.evergage.com https://apis.google.com https://www.gstatic.com https://cdn.pendo.io https://app.pendo.io https://cdn.pendo.io https://pendo-io-static.storage.googleapis.com https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://cdn.pendo.io https://cdn.elev.io https://*.zdassets.com https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com https://fonts.googleapis.com https://www.gstatic.com https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; font-src 'self' data: https://fonts.gstatic.com https://css.zohostatic.com https://*.zopim.com https://themes.googleusercontent.com; report-uri /ducs/v1/public/cspReport; connect-src 'self' https://notify.bugsnag.com https://sessions.bugsnag.com https://*.bettercloud.com https://script.google.com https://script.googleusercontent.com https://*.elev.io https://g.alicdn.com https://fullstory.com wss://*.zopim.com https://*.zopim.com https://ipv4.google.com https://*.fullstory.com wss://*.elev.io https://app.pendo.io; frame-src 'self' https://bettercloud.youcanbook.me https://betterit.cloud https://cdn.elev.io https://accounts.google.com https://app.elev.io; base-uri 'self' https://cdn.elev.io; form-action 'self'; img-src data: blob: * https://cdn.pendo.io https://app.pendo.io https://cdn.pendo.io https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; media-src https://*.zopim.com;

post.description:
Execute an action using BetterCloud's Action Engine.

Actions are executed asynchronously. After successfully initiating an action, an `executionId` will be returned in the response body.
The `executionId` can be used to poll the execution status.

A common use case is to execute a specific action every time an event occurs in another system.  For example, if you want to have BetterCloud create a Google user everytime a user is created in BambooHR, you can configure BambooHR to send push notifications to this endpoint.  The request payload from BambooHR will not match our expected contract, so you would have to use a pre-request script (can be created at https://developer.bettercloud.com/#/scripts/new).  In order to tell our system what pre-request scripts you would like to run, you can apply the list of script IDs as either the `BC-Transform-IDs` header or the `BC-Transform-IDs` query parameter.  If you provide multiple script IDs, they will be executed in the order provided.

The best way to determine the request body is to view the Network Tab in your browser tools while executing the action inside BCX.  Because this experience is not pleasant, we have simplified the contract and encourage using the above `Execute Action`.

Deprecated in favor of the above `Execute Action`

https://api.bettercloud.com

text/plain.example: POST, GET, PUT, OPTIONS, DELETE, PATCH

default-src 'none'; script-src 'self' 'sha256-xWNWy6g4QpHCwZRdmLfI81eyBjRIztPmws2tVdvXBmg=' https://g.alicdn.com https://fullstory.com https://storage.googleapis.com https://*.atlassian.net https://*.elev.io https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com https://ajax.googleapis.com https://*.zopim.com https://*.fullstory.com https://accounts.google.com https://cdn.evergage.com https://bettercloud.evergage.com https://apis.google.com https://www.gstatic.com https://cdn.pendo.io https://app.pendo.io https://cdn.pendo.io https://pendo-io-static.storage.googleapis.com https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' https://cdn.pendo.io https://cdn.elev.io https://*.zdassets.com https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com https://fonts.googleapis.com https://www.gstatic.com https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; font-src 'self' data: https://fonts.gstatic.com https://css.zohostatic.com https://*.zopim.com https://themes.googleusercontent.com; report-uri /ducs/v1/public/cspReport; connect-src 'self' https://notify.bugsnag.com https://sessions.bugsnag.com https://*.bettercloud.com https://script.google.com https://script.googleusercontent.com https://*.elev.io https://g.alicdn.com https://fullstory.com wss://*.zopim.com https://*.zopim.com https://ipv4.google.com https://*.fullstory.com wss://*.elev.io https://app.pendo.io; frame-src 'self' https://bettercloud.youcanbook.me https://betterit.cloud https://cdn.elev.io https://accounts.google.com https://app.elev.io; base-uri 'self' https://cdn.elev.io; form-action 'self'; img-src data: blob: * https://cdn.pendo.io https://app.pendo.io https://cdn.pendo.io https://pendo-static-4896387203858432.storage.googleapis.com; media-src https://*.zopim.com;

get.description:
Retrieve a list of your BetterCloud Workflow names and IDs.
Use this endpoint for auditing the names and count of workflows or to identify the `workflowId` needed to execute a specific workflow.

https://api.bettercloud.com

text/plain.example: POST, GET, PUT, OPTIONS, DELETE, PATCH:

post.description:
Execute your BetterCloud Workflows through the API.

Workflows are executed asynchronously. See the above endpoint for retrieving the properties that are required to execute the workflow.

https://api.bettercloud.com

text/plain.example: POST, GET, PUT, OPTIONS, DELETE, PATCH
